title: Dionysus - For Theatre: Phase 1
description: There are countries that lack infrastructure and a support system for the performing arts that helps support their growth.

f6_assessments.q0: The performing arts have suffered greatly during this pandemic. Creating a successful DAO that helps the performing arts industry could bring a lot of new people to use Cardano. A DAO is able to scale and very resilient to future challenges and risks.
f6_assessments.q1: Why wait for funding to start building the front end. Having experienced developers on your team, you could build a mockup website/app to showcase your skills and ideas for this project. This will boost voter confidence tremendously.  Budget allocation and plan seems sensible though.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal has a detailed roadmap with major milestones to track success. They offer a clear solution to support and grow the performing arts industry. An industry that is suffering in this pandemic. Tokenomics still needs to be revealed, which could have a major impact on voters' decision. Success hasn't been clearly defined. You could ad an amount of successful events after a certain period of time or a number of active community members. Any indicators or goals that would deem the project a success. They haven't really considered any risks or challenges, but did include the probability of a testnet before mainnet. That would be the safe route to go.  And being a DAO helps with being resilient to challenges along the way.

f6_assessments.q0: Using NFTs as event tickets (D-tix) addresses the challenge brief of creating business models with NFT's at the core. Minting and using NFTs for tickets will increase the use and number of NFTs on Cardano, thus increasing utility and providing value to the ecosystem. I would like the team to redefine the problem statement and solution, as written at the moment it is unclear how NFT will form the solution to the problem presented.
f6_assessments.q1: Although the team provided a links to websites and LinkedIn profiles, I feel the proposal requires further development to ensure successful implementation. I would like the team to expand on the responsibilities and deliverables of each member of the team, this allows insight on whether there is a work overload in one area. I advise the team to develop a risk assessment considering the challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation, the team needs to think: "what needs to be true for this project to succeed".
f6_assessments.q2: The team provided a single line budget. I would like to see the team further develop and define Key Performance Indicators (KPI's) for the project – example "Mint 50 NFTs by month 2, or sign up 100 users by month x, etc"– set measurables for performance and use it as a KPI, then connect the KPI to the milestones on the project roadmap. By  connecting the KPI's and roadmap milestones to the budget, in this way you can track performance and spending over a timeline . As the project stand at the moment, I feel the project will be challenging to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to alleviate financial burdens on the performing arts by decentralized finance model with building it funding system based on voting. The concept is in line with the core principles of blockchain therefore there is a need to encourage such experiments. There is a need to define tokanamics and risk management strategies which are likely to be complex and may need detailed analysis. However, there is a need to start some were and the proposal is just doing that.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have about 25 years of combined experience with a mix of arts and app development. This is a perfect mixture. There are substantial technical challenges in achieving the aim in terms of staking, rewards, and treasury maintenance. Therefore it is a high-risk endeavor.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a clear aim and a well-laid out rollout plan in 5 testnet phases followed by mainnet phase. The requested amount is quite less when the amount of work is required to be carried out. There is no information on how the later phases will be financed with no revenue model is given. Assuming the rest of the requirement will be pooled in by the proposers it can be seen that the proposal is clearly auditable.

f6_assessments.q0: I love the idea, and it fits in the challenge. I was waiting for NFT to become tickets, so I could be sure it's authentic and i'd have a memorial forever in the blockchain to all the shows I've seen.
f6_assessments.q1:
The fact that you've put in Linkedin profiles gives greater credibility to the proposal IMO and more if not all proposals should do this if applicable.
The roadmap seems well planned out and the timetable seems doable. 
I really like the commitment you seem to have to this project and the fact that you've thought about the current situation and that some people won't be able to be present live on the shows and you've got them covered with online versions of the shows is great.
Considering the price you're asking for the work to be done, it seems like a no-brainer to me. I hope you reach your goal. Good luck!
f6_assessments.q2: There will be an open-source repository and anyone interested will be able to follow the project's progress. As a developer that's all I need to track progress, but non-tech-savvy people might have some issues in that regard. It would be nice if think about a forum or a newsletter sharing your development with all your community supporters.

solution: Leveraging NFT's and Cardano, we want to create a system that rewards supporters while growing the industry.
experience: 6yrs Full Stack Engineer, 4yrs Android Developer specialized in payment systems, 4yrs Tech Journalist with performing arts experience.
